result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Mykal Travis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying Concealed Weapon. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Mykal Travis

records.addlTxt: Assessment for attorney fees and costs in the amount of $200.00 entered as ordered by the court on 10/14/22 to pay $30.00 monthly. Final due payment due by 5/1/23.  Failure to pay is a civil judgment.  sb
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    JOHN  KREJCI  $200.00

Defendant Justin Mykal Travis in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Justin Mykal Travis.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status Conference.  Parties held negotiations off the record.  
Negotiations placed on the record. Upon the motion of the County. Court ordered charge amended to 63.015, County Ordinance violation, to which Defendant plead no contest. Defendant found guilty of amended charge. Court ordered a forfeiture in the amount of $200.00 inclusive of costs, to be paid by 12/27/2022.  Failure to pay will result in civil forfeiture/tax intercept.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 1st, 2022

Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Indigency Hearing held. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney John Krejci to represent defendant at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant to repay the County at a rate of $30.00 PER WEEK. Repayment to begin OCTOBER 28TH, 2022. Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel.

Defendant Justin Mykal Travis in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for Calendar Call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court cancelled stayed bench warrant. Indigency hearing to proceed.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant appeared in Court at 4:30 p.m. stating he was on time and unable to locate the courtroom.
Court allows the September 1, 2022 calendar call to be moved from 3:00pm to 4:00pm.
Defendant was provided with amended notice of hearing for next scheduled court date.
Calendar call on September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Justin Mykal Travis not in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for indigency hearing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Justin Mykal Travis in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justin Mykal Travis appeared by video means.
Defendant is not eligible for SPD counsel and is unable to retain private counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for indigency hearing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Justin Mykal Travis in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES Branch 13, Room 508 of the courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/16/2022 @2p
